description.p: The following issue was raised following a review of the ISO 10303-239 proof provided by ISO.
ISO have moved the express directory (iso10303_239/express) containing all the module express files to the Electronic inserts directory. (Electronic_inserts\C038310e_Electronic_inserts\express)
Fine. However, the iso10303_239_readme.txt is now incorrect. The following phrase should be removed.
description.screen: The EXPRESS listings that are referenced in this part are collected in the express folder. The ARM EXPRESS listing for part 239 is contained in file: express/part239IS_wgnarm.exp The MIM EXPRESS listing for part 239 is contained in file: express/part239IS_wgnmim.exp
description.p: Assuming that ISO intend to use this structure for all modular APs, we have corrected STEPmod so that this part and all other parts built using STEPmod are correct.

In addition, there is currently no Readme to go with the Electronic inserts. We have also identified that there were some EXPRESS files that should have been copied across as well for convenience (The common resource parts). We have therefore modified STEPmod to:

ul.li: Copy the missing common resource files;
auto generate the following Readme that will be stored in the Express folder in the Electronic inserts.

description.screen: This directory contains all the EXPRESS files that are normatively referenced by these parts. Note that the EXPRESS files have been copied from the corresponding hyperlinked modules and resources and collected here for convenience. The EXPRESS files for the ARM of the modules are named: part<part_no><status>_<WG_no>arm.exp The EXPRESS files for the MIM of the modules are named: part<part_no><status>_<WG_no>mim.exp Where: <part_no> is the number of the part <status> is the ISO status of the part (ts for Technical Specification) <WG_no> is the ISO SC4 working group number The name traces the files back to their originating document for audit purposes. The EXPRESS files for the common resource parts have the same name as the resource schema. </WG_no>
